intro: Tripteris limonifolia, commonly known as lemon-leaf tripteris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stems.
